name: Devin J. Balkcom
content: Balkcom @ Dartmouth devin.balkcom@dartmouth.edu ECSC 109 I'm a professor in the Dartmouth Computer Science department, currently serving as department chair. I co-direct the Reality and Robotics Lab. Research I'm interested in efficient robot designs and motion. Research highlights include exact time-optimal motion for mobile robots, robot origami, knot-tying, laundry folding, and construction of interlocking structures. See the project pages for more detail: Tying: simple devices that tie knots Folding: robot origami and laundry folding Assembly: building robust structures from smaller components Geodesics: efficient motion and planning for robots Human motion: technology for teaching humans how to move Here are a few videos from our youtube channel: Publications 2024 Energy-optimal trajectories for skid-steer rovers Meysam Effati, Krzysztof Skonieczny, Devin J.
